Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2012 09:17PM kwithtwo wrote: Angie,  Hi, how are you doing??  Have you had surgery yet?  Did you see a breast specialist surgeon?   I have been diagnosed, today, with the same.  I am sure surgeon will recommend surgical excision.  I had a suspicious area 18 months ago that was surgically removed but turned out to be benign calcifications.  This mammogram was supposed to be my "aha" moment where it was all clear and I go back to yearly mammo's.  Instead, there was yet another area suspicious.  I had the stereotactic biopsy on Friday last week and the radiologist called today with the results.  This is totally different that the last time.  I'm quite sure, with my history, that my surgeon will opt to surgically remove.   Mine is intraductal papillomatosis with mild atypia hyperplasia.  And it's lateral on my breast, not directly behind the nipple.   How are you feeling?  I hope you are doing well and all has been removed and benign!!  Peace and Grace, Kim
Posts.Title: Intraductal papillomatosis with mild atypia akc820608 kwithtwo
